message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.SY, cs.AI 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper deals with Cognitive Radio Networks and their ability to access licensed spectrum without causing interference to primary users. 
2. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper proposes a Bayesian decision rule based algorithm to solve the problem of maximizing the total expected system throughput. 
3. cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) - The paper deals with the challenge of detecting PU transmissions in CRNs and proposes a cooperative sensing approach to improve sensing accuracy. 
4. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper formulates an optimization problem to maximize system throughput and proposes a greedy algorithm to solve it. 
5. cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) - The paper proposes a decision rule based algorithm to solve the optimization problem and investigates the case for which a constraint is put on the sensing time overhead.
